definition: to have an urge/to be impetuous/impulse/urge
thoroughfare/to go straight ahead/to rush/to clash
(of water) to dash against/to mix with water/to infuse/to rinse/to flush/to develop (a film)/to rise in the air/to clash/to collide with
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb

sentences.english: Nothing is a treasure, it makes the poor have the impulse to change destiny.
sentences.chinese: 一无所有是一种财富，它让穷人产生改变命运的冲动。

sentences.english: Was he simply obeying a sort of instinctive impulse which was obscure even to himself?
sentences.chinese: 还是他受了一种连他自己也无法了解的本能的冲动呢？
性冲动本能的力量是什么？

sentences.english: They carry a nerve impulse across the gap between nerve cells.
sentences.chinese: 它们把神经冲动带到神经细胞之间的空隙中。

sentences.english: Surprised, Agam With all of a sudden urge to run.
sentences.chinese: 吃惊之后，阿甘忽然有了跑步的冲动。

sentences.english: I'm assuming this child also is impulsive.
sentences.chinese: 我假设这个孩子也是容易冲动的。

sentences.english: It appears you are the emotional one, but am I offended?
sentences.chinese: 你现在好像也很冲动，得罪朕了么？

sentences.english: On a whim, Gromph decided to test the child.
sentences.chinese: 在冲动之下，贡夫决定对这孩子进行测试。

sentences.english: Humans also have the mental capacity to make decisions not based on impulse.
sentences.chinese: 人类也有着不根据冲动而依靠心智作出决定的能力。
你是一个冲动型消费者吗？

sentences.english: Emotional pulse and burning of imagination only means external manifestations of the desire.
sentences.chinese: 情感的冲动，想象的燃烧，只是欲望的外在表现形式。

sentences.english: I exercise poor judgement in my decisions and my usual obsessive planning gives way to impulsiveness.
sentences.chinese: 我的判断变差了而且我惯常的执念给冲动让道了。

sentences.english: Steve Mirsky reportsCompulsive gambling is marked by poor impulse control.
sentences.chinese: 赌博成瘾的人被认为是缺乏对于冲动的控制力的。

sentences.english: The art brings out a graving to be close to nature, a desire to go back "home".
sentences.chinese: 这门艺术表达了人们接近自然和“回家”的原始冲动。

sentences.english: What impulse ? it ' s called vandalism.
sentences.chinese: 什么冲动？那叫故意破坏艺术。

sentences.english: Tuotuo was sitting near the water and watching the moon rise, there was an urge to howl.
sentences.chinese: 脱脱坐在水池边抬头看月亮，有一种想嚎叫的冲动。

definition: way of thinking/opinion/notion/to think of a way (to do sth)/CL:個|个[ge4]
to act impetuously (idiom); on an impulse
